name: Bhoota Kola
description: 'Bhoota Kola' is a ritualistic folk dance-worship of spirits of the land, observed in coastal parts of South India (extending from districts in Karnataka to Kerala). There are over a hundred such spirits, each worshiped for its unique powers. The worship is an elaborate night-long event held at permanent shrines or at temporary sheds. With rapid urbanization taking over, such rituals are gradually fading away from public sight and memory.
